Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: skeeboy
Reviews.Content: Great little place to stay. Check in & out was super simple. Old bungalows have been converted to quaint rooms comfortably furnished & decorated. Walking distance to Hollywood & Vine & multiple restaurants. Off street parking is a plus...literally can reach from your car to the room in 2 steps. Not for those who want to be pampered, but if you're a little adventurous, give this place a try. I'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: chloe b
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Villa Della Stella three times. I absolutely love this hotel. It is so homey and comfortable. I've stayed in The Hollywood Glamour, The Parisian and The Enchanted Cottage. Every room is complete with a kitchen and amazing decor. The sheets on the bed are to die for. The hotel is so close to amazing restaurants, stores, night clubs and so much more. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I can promise that you will have a wonderful experience. Not only is the hotel fabulous so are the owners. They are so kind, hospitable and sweet. If you want to be comfortable, feel fabulous and have an amazing experience than I would definitely stay here. It is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Cosy Stay”
Reviews.Author: charglob
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at Villa Delle Stelle in the Le Petite Suite. There was plenty of room for the hire car off the street and the location is within walking distance to Hollywood Boulevard and the walk of Fame, we also walked to Melrose Avenue for shopping bit it was a bit of a walk. Plenty of restaurants and really good shopping is in walking distance too. The unit was very clean and super cosy, with a fully equipt kitchen, clean bathroom and really comfortable bed! 2 tvs - one in the lounge area and one in the bed area made my partner very happy as he wanted to watch ESPN 24/7. The only problem we had was the neighbor went out late every night with their food van and sometimes woke us up, but this cant be helped by the hotel and i guess people have to make a living :) it wasn't too much of a disturbance. I would recommend this place to anyone as LA is really hard to try and decide where to stay as it is so big, this was a great location to base ourselves and drive around in the hire car or take a tour bus around.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Mark H
Reviews.Content: This rental was during my last few days in California. It was on the tail-end of a week and a half on the West Coast. I was worried about the area, after I booked I was told horror stories about west hollywood, but everything worked out perfectly. The 'room' I rented was actually the cottage suite. Our parking spot was in the driveway, fenced in. Kitchen: Large kitchen with stove-top, oven, sink, and full-size fridge. Fully stocked with cooking materials 9pots, pans, plates, bowls, forks, knives). There is no microwave (weird) so be aware when you go grocery shopping. Everything is clean, and they have garbage bags, sponges, soap, etc. The rest of the suite: Living room has two couches and a chair, large TV with Direct TV. Dining room table was big. I was ironing in the living room with the window AC unit on, and I blew a fuse/circuit. They sent someone out in 5-10 minutes to fix this. Bedroom: Bedroom was CRAMPED. The king-size bed took up basically the whole room. There is a TV you can watch while laying down. There is a door that leads to the driveway in the bedroom. NOTE-they rent a spot in the driveay to a food-truck (tacos or something) so early in the morning you hear them banging around outside loading the truck, and around twilight they are back parking the truck. It wasn't too much of a bother, but some people wouldn't like this. Area: There is a Trader Joe's nearby, so we stocked up on cheap wine and easy-prep meals. we also walked to Hollywood Blvd and ate at a sushi place in the plaza that has the kodak theatre. The area is fine, don't beleive people that say its ghetto. Plenty of bars and other attractions in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own plunger!”
Reviews.Author: pluggerSydney
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel in Hollywood. The guide book in the room mentioned that the pipes were old and, sure enough, the toilet backed up on day one. Apart from the pipes the vanity in the bathroom needs attention and the random hours at the office are not helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and comfortable, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Scooterpooch
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Parisian suite for 4 nights with our family of 4, This was a perfect haven from the hurly burly of Los Angeles, it was good to have a well appointed designer kitchen and to be able to have the choice to dine in our rooms if we wanted to. Our host Brogan was so friendly and helpful. The rooms are beautifully designed and decorated, although starting to suffer a little wear and in need of maintenance in some areas. Nevertheless we felt privileged to be staying in such a beautiful designer apartment. The location is perfect as well - a short walk from the main part of Hollywood yet far enough way not to be part of the hustle and bustle. Our car park was roomy enough for our SUV but I could see that other parking spots could be a bit squishy. If you have a medium to large car ask for the Parisian suite which has the parking spot right off the street and next to the entrance.

Reviews.Title: “SO comfy!”
Reviews.Author: J C
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week and loved it. The bed was confortable and the bathroom well appointed. The kitchen had everything necessary. Right around the corner from Roscoe's chicken and waffles, yum. DO rent a small car however as when they specify the size of the parking space they are not kidding! The owners are lovely and the neighborhood is quiet. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Your own little sanctuary”
Reviews.Author: Perrin123
Reviews.Content: Stayed in La Petite Suite which is small (as the name would suggest) but perfect for two. We were able to check in early for a small fee which was welcomed after the long flight. The bed is one of the most comfortable I have slept in, and the whole place is clean with good use made of the space. Located in a residential area, and a short walk to the Hollywood Blvd and close to public transport. This was far better than a non descript hotel. Comfy, homely and great value in a good location. It was a pleasure to return to each day. Highly recommended and would stay here agian without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Find in Hollywood!!”
Reviews.Author: bphawk64
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in the "Enchanted Cottage" at Villa Delle Stelle in Hollywood, CA and were very impressed with our room. The cottage was bigger and nicer than we expected and was priced well under what I would expect to pay for this type of accomodation in Los Angeles. The Cottage consisted of a full kitchen that was well stocked, a living room with flat screen tv, dining room, large bathroom and a good sized bedroom with a second flat screen tv. The bedroom also had doors out to a wrap-around deck. The cottage seemed much more like our home away from home than a hotel room. There are some differences to this type of hotel than a regular hotel room that people should be aware of. These are not bad things and I actually really liked the concept. I never met anyone in person from the hotel as we arrived late and the code to enter the cottage had been emailed to me. The keys, welcome info and credit card receipt were waiting for us when we arrived. We did not have housekeeping in our cottage while there but there were plenty of towels, etc for us .I also knew this going in and was fine with it. Villa Delle Stelle is located in a residential area about 1/2 mile or so from all the major attractions on Hollywood Boulevard and was within easy walking distance. The Enchanted Cottage was a bit difficult to find at night as the address was actually located on the curb. Maybe just operator error on my part but good information to know. Parking is tight but sufficientand is free. About the only issue we had was that the hotel specified parking for compact cars only and the people staying in the villa next to us had a very large SUV. This made it next to impossible to park in our designated spot but I solved that issue buy just parking behind them. The hotel staff said they would resolve the parking issue and we never saw the SUV again...not sure if they checked out or were asked to park elsewhere. Either way, it appears all of the villas have free parking but they mean when they say large cars or trucks won't fit. The villa also had Direct TV connected to the tv's and the villa was wired for free wi-fi. The wi-fi worked ok but at times was quite slow. This could have been due to some bad weather and didn't affect us much at all. Overall, this is an excellent option in Hollywood...especially for someone who doesn't need or want all the normal hotel amenities. For me Villa Delle Stelle will be the first place I call to make a reservation for my next trip to Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy little suite”
Reviews.Author: Lor81
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the petite suite on 9/10 for a night after watching a concert at the Greek Theater. Very small but cozy & cute. Perfect for 2 people. They have a binder set up with nearby attractions, taxi services, maps & take out menus. It's like having your own little apartment in the city. Very highly recommended, I wish we would have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay here”
Reviews.Author: Ken G
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant about coming to the Villa Delle Stelle, but took a chance after seeing good reviews on this site. I am very happy I did choose this hotel. Its a not an actual hotel per se, but a series of homes that have been remodeled in different themes. I stayed in the Caribbean suite, and I loved it. One of my friends and his girlfriend took a look inside and said it was fantastic. The suite I got was very clean, bedding and sheets clean. Some may say that thought the hotel was dirty, but its the decor. In my suite I everything was old (except appliances which were new) not bad old, but old with a purpose. The neighborhood can seem seedy, but its downtown hollyweird. I had no issues during my stay. Its located between Sunset and Hollywood blvd, which means your within walking distance of the sights. Parking is a bit tight, definately no big trucks. I highly recommend this Hotel if your looking for a quaint bungalow.

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret in Los Angeles!”
Reviews.Author: ErikaLamoureaux
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Villa Delle Stelle on and off for nearly two months while I was displaced from my home due to a plumbing flood. What a Godsend! I was lucky enough to get to experience several of their fabulous rooms. I never felt like I was living in a "hotel;" instead I felt like I had walked into my very own vacation home. The rooms are beautifully decorated and have everything you could possibly need....corkscrews, wine glasses, large salad mixing bowls, you name it, it's there. I also found the owners and their employee to be incredibly gracious and welcoming. They went way up and beyond the call of duty to make a very difficult time in my life easier. Upon occasion a bottle of wine, gourmet cheese and crackers would show up in my room. They also provided a contact for a very reasonably priced and extremely talented masseuse. I loved the place so much I suggested it to my boyfriend's daughter and her wedding party as a place to stay for their wedding weekend. I'm also looking forward to booking a few days in the near future for a little 'staycation' getaway.

Reviews.Title: “this place was exactly what we wanted- it was great!”
Reviews.Author: abbou_belghazi
Reviews.Content: my girlfriend and i were looking for an inexpensive and cute place to stay while in LA for my brothers art exhibition. Villa Delle Stelle was perfectly located just off sunset and THREE blocks from the farmers market. we stayed in 2 different rooms there- the cottage and neo classic, and both were super comfy and clean and well done. even the books on the bookshelves were neat! Not to mention, i left a sketchbook in one of the rooms by accident after i left, and the staff there (kristen i cant thank you enough) were kind and awesome in finding it and sending it to me. all in all, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Querky”
Reviews.Author: RatsBirmingham
Reviews.Content: We were only in LA for one night and chose Hotel Villa Delle Stelle for its location primarily. Although its off Sunset Boulevard, should you want to walk to the heart of Hollywood its quite a long way and walking back in the dark we did feel a little vulnerable. The hotel is in a very quiet pretty road and you have to look twice to make sure you're at the right place. Its more like a slightly tired b&b than a hotel but its spotlessly clean and having the facility of a kitchen I imagine would be great for some people. I did particularly like the bed which was so high off the floor (but very comfy) you could imagine getting a nose bleed. It was fitted into a mirrored alcove with a huge ceiling fan above you. All very different and as I said 'querky'. My one little moan was I wasn't quite prepared for a fast food truck to be parked up on the drive next to our window that night. This normally wouldn't have been a problem if it wasn't for the fact we were still trying to adjust to LA time and desperately needed sleep. The truck arrived about 9ish (i think) and then it was being cleaned out for about an hour which meant our room was lit up and we had some noise. So depending on your circumstances this may or may not be a hindrance.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: SBCATraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because it was close to the Music Box where we were seeing a concert. We stayed in the Caribbean Suite. It was more than large enough for two people. This was an older cottage, but cozy. There is free parking, which is a plus in LA, but the parking space is quite small. Only small cars is allowed. We had a problem with the lock on our door and it was promptly taken care of. It was a clean place, but the outdoor furniture really needs to updated. They advertising an outside patio, but you wouldn't want to sit on the rusty chairs. There was another table & chairs in the front that were better, but all in all the outdoor furniture needs replacement. It was easy walking distance to the concert hall and to restaurants, which were our host gave us various recommendations. If you want to stay in this area of LA, this is a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! A charming, comfy, cozy stay, near most everything.”
Reviews.Author: 1pickygirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in LA for business but wanted to stay somewhere unique. Villa Delle Stelle was the perfect place. We stayed in the La Petite Suite, which was cozy but so charming and comfortable. Although it is situated in the middle, between two other residences, we never heard the neighbors. The suite was well decorated and I've never slept on such soft sheets nor had towels as plush in any hotel. They really did everything right. Not being familiar with the area, we drove to dinner and other excursions. The restaurant recommendations they gave (handy book in the room) were fantastic. It was a great experience, in a convenient location, close to so much. We'd definitely stay there on our next LA trip.

Reviews.Title: “They are cheaters!”
Reviews.Author: Sue32849
Reviews.Content: Never suggest anyone to go there! Incredibly stupid and useless, selfish owners and stuff. We booked the hotel through booking.com and received the confirmation. We arrived at 10 pm with parents over 60-year-age. However, they doubled booked the room and it was already occupied. After 4 phone calls and 1 hour wait time since the owner said that she was having dinner, we spent another 2 hours until passed midnight trying to find another hotel. They did not say anything about compensating the rate difference or other costs that were stated in the policy. They actually found our booking on booking.com. But instead of apologizing about it and trying to help us to locate a hotel, the other two women kept on asking us how come we did not know that we suppose to get an e-mail from them in addition to the e-mail from Booking.com. We finally lucked out with a hotel in the Korean town outside of Hollywood, which costed us much more and we only got to sleep about 1:30 am. What a bunch of losers! They only cared about making money, and did not care that they are ruining other people's vacation time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place, our 2nd visit, we will be back again!”
Reviews.Author: AKATCambridge
Reviews.Content: Villa Dell Stelle is the perfect choice for us in LA as the accommodation is spacious, charming and literally a home from home. We stayed in the new duplex (Hollywood glamour suite) and we have also stayed in the bungalow too. Both have every convenience that you would want for self catering. The Hollywood Glamour suite is newly renovated and very spacious. There is a fantastic patio with seating and a dining table. Although the management keep their distance (you can go the duration of your stay with no contact) which is fine by me, when we did need to speak to them they were very helpful. There is a very comprehensive file in the apartment with information on just about everything that you would need to know. I am English and am used to a slightly more shabby chic kind of interior, so it is literally like a home from home. This is not for: someone that wants an ultra modern/pristine place to stay- so you need to be aware of that when booking. I personally love the quirky touches. Negatives- The worst was the parking...................The Hollywood Glamour suite is situated away from the main house in a duplex with another suite, on the website it states that the other suite has a parking space for a compact car. When you arrive and leaf through the file with all of the info, you are told that the parking space for your suite is to the right on the driveway. All 3 nights the people in the next door suite had a large SUV which obviously did not fit the alloted parking space, so we had to squeeze our car into the compact space (as it was nearer to a compact size). The neighbourhood is not a great area for walking around (not bad , but also not the best). All things considered for me self catering does not get any better than this and any negative comment- is just being honest but we accept this place with those niggles and will definitely return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in a seedy area”
Reviews.Author: EyeWonderArts
Reviews.Content: Villa Delle Stelle is a beautiful boutique of themed rooms that are tastefully decorated. Although we didn't care much for LA, the hotel made up for it. We even spent some days in because the rooms were so comfortable. It felt like we were in our own penthouse apartment. The main downside is it's proximity to some establishments that attract argumentative people who swear profanities and nearly fist fight until 2 am on the weekends. The location is also very noisy-helicopters, trash trucks, men whistling at women, and so on. For us the noise was too much and the fighting in the streets unbearable. We couldn't wait to leave. On the plus side, the bed was very comfortable, plenty of space for our things, free water and free parking-a big plus. The host, Brogan, was very welcoming and kind upon our arrival and when we needed help doing laundry.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful weekend at Villa Delle Stelle”
Reviews.Author: jennipoo82
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a weekend in Hollywood with my husband for our anniversary. Villa Delle Stelle was perfect for us. It seems any of the negative comments people had really come from having the wrong expectations. This is not your typical chain hotel. It is a lovely home that sits in a regular neighborhood in Hollywood. There is not a 24 hr. front desk, you basically get your own little apartment in Hollywood which is exactly the way we like to travel. As for the tight parking spaces, yes they're a little small but no smaller than many spots in the city...and free! Any nearby hotels were charging $20/night for parking so I was happy to have the space. I stayed in one of the new bungalows around the corner and I'm sure each room is so different that I can really only comment on our Le Petit Suite. It was small but very cozy for us, again if you are expecting a giant hotel room you shouldn't book something called "petit". We loved it. The layout was great for such a small space, there was a separate living room and even a small kitchen. And a full size shower with an awesome showerhead, great water pressure isn't always easy to find. The bed was SOOOO comfortable. The only complaint I could have is that it is a little stuffy--it sits between two other suites so windows are only on one wall and they don't stay up--but there was an air conditioner so problem solved. We walked everywhere, coming home late in the evening both nights. Yes there were some "characters" (this is Hollywood after all) on the streets but we never felt unsafe. I thought the location was ideal, close enough to walk to the main Hollywood sights but far enough away that we felt we got away to our retreat. I would love to come back and check out the other suites at Villa Delle Stelle.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky accommodation, but not all that bad”
Reviews.Author: Iris_dk
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the B & B/small hotel, we were first met with the challenge of parking in a spot so tight I had to get out before my husband drove into the carport. He had quite a time each time of getting out, but the car would drive itself in so it had to be done. Getting the car out was no less challenging, but fortunately my husband enjoys these challenges. Each suite has a designated parking space, so if you do book with this B & B, make sure to ask whether he parking is on the side of the driveway or behind the house, if it is the latter, give it a miss. When we entered the area to our rooms, we were horrified to be confronted with the rubbish bins, the utilities area and a general mess of cables. Our hearts sank at the sight of this, but the rooms themselves were lovely (although very, very dark). We stayed in the neo-classical suite which is basically a small apartment. The bedroom was a fair size, and had the best mattress and pillows (although the bed linen needs an update), the kitchen fully-equipped, the bathroom very nice. The Dining room, however, is just a dark room with a table in the middle of it and a huge sofa around it. Needs some re-thinking. The apartment is nicely furnished with some interesting bits. The bathroom was great and there were lots of plush towels. The area is not that nice, but close to restaurants and you see the Hollywood sign every day. I tried to find someone at the office every day as I had some questions, but no one ever answered. You are really on your own. However, there is a book in the room with lots and lots of useful information. All in all, the place was okay, but we wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming, very comfortable. Like stepping back in time”
Reviews.Author: JenAnnB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Bungalow with our teenage daughter. While it has been a while since the rooms were decorated, the place was totally captivating. Despite what the other reviewer said, the house was full of light! Of course, one needs to open the blinds to let the light in ;) The little twin bedroom had windows on three sides, as did the livingroom/main bedroom, with its very comfortable king bed. Many of the original fittings are still there, including the tiles in the bathroom and kitchen, and there is a vintage gas stove that works perfectly. Living it the Bungalow, you could imagine yourself in old Hollywood. The location is good, handy to the walk of fame, and to historic theatres. We enjoyed seeing a movie in one of them, complete with live organist. Also convenient is an excellent supermarket, and many good restaurants within walking distance. Of course, it's also necessary to have a car in LA, and it was very handy having our own parking spot. We found the setting very quiet - one could wake up to the sound of birds chirping. I should mention that the property is up for sale - I hope the new owners retain it as a hotel, as we would look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Bungalow Suite not as it looks on the web although great location”
Reviews.Author: lalabear01
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights as part of a trip taking in New York and San Francisco - travelling with teenagers I was really keen to find somewhere central in LA with a seperate bedroom for the teenagers - we choose the Bungalow suite and I think there in lay the problem - the photos on the web and the majority of the reviews were for the other suites within the house. Positives: - Great location Kodak Theatre and Hollywood Boulevard are walkable (although I wouldn't recommend this at night!) - Hollywood sign can be seen from the road just outside the house. Cash and Brogan were really helpful and printed tickets and flight itineries for us Wi Fi Internet connection excellent 2 TVs with huge amount of cable channels The bungalow is really pretty from the outside and has a small patio area with a BBQ for outside seating Plentiful towels and pair of dressing gowns Negatives :- The Bungalow suite - designed in 50's style is dark, dusty and doesn't look anything like the photos on the web - the main bed was huge with smaller twin beds in an adjoining small, dark room . We stayed for 6 nights - $250 per night (including tax) but the bungalow wasn't cleaned or the bedding and towels changed at all through our stay! Like any city centre location there are some uncomfortable places and I certainly didn't feel comfortable walking back from the Chinese Theatre at night -although taxi's are plentiful I would recommend but choose one of the other suites.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the City”
Reviews.Author: RAGwoman1
Reviews.Content: Our family of three spent a few nights at the Villa recently for the beginning of our drive from Los Angeles to San Francisco with a few stops in between; we rented the bungalow. What a charming cottage! Roomy enough for all of us with a lovely welcome gift waiting as we checked in. Our rental car was a perfect fit for the space in front of the house. The bed was very comfortable; made it hard to get up early in the mornings! Met a very nice woman there who was staying in one of the other suites and met her sweet baby daughter. Felt like a neighborhood; highly recommend this place. Close for walking to some of the Hollywood sites. As an added bonus. "Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles" is right around the corner. Making the reservations online was easy and quick; it was different not meeting any of the staff, but it worked out just fine for us. Thanks, Villa Delle Stelle, for a great start to our nine-day vacation in California!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Old like staying in appartment”
Reviews.Author: Malishka101
Reviews.Content: We staid with my husband for one night. Place is dusty and dirty even towels and plates. Nice pictures on the web, everything is the same, but 10 years older. Very loud noise from upstairs rooms and outside. No privacy since windows looking out to the driveway of the house next door. It's a good option if you need to rent an apartment. Will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back again!”
Reviews.Author: JustMarried418
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are finishing up our stay in the Neoclassic room so while I am sitting here in the kitchen, on the computer (internet access has been extremely reliable), and while everything is still fresh in my mind, I'd thought I'd share the highlights of our stay. Location, TripAdvisor reviews, and a fantastic promotional offer were our reasons for booking this suite at Ville Delle Stelle. It was nice to walk right up to the entry of our suite, find the key in the location emailed to us before we arrived, and settle in ... a definite change from the usual "hotel" check-in. We liked the feeling that we were staying in an apartment rather than just a hotel room. The suite features all the amenities of an apartment ... full kitchen with stove, fridge, sink, dishwasher, and all the dishware, utensils, pots and pans you would need to make all of your meals. There's even coffee, tea, sugar and creamer, enough to get you through the first morning! Just beyond the kitchen is a dining room that is available to guests which was a pleasant surprise. The bathroom is equipped with a hairdryer, full-size bottles of shampoo, conditioner and shower gel, moisturizer, yummy towels and, the best part, a rainshower shower head ... my husband said he would come back just for that! The bed is one of the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in. We like it cool when we sleep and the A/C unit was perfect! My only complaint for the entire stay is that, on our second night, we could hear the guests in the suite above sliding furniture about but, thankfully, we were only inconvenienced for a short time. The location suited our needs for this trip. We came down from Northern California to attend a taping of a show at a studio within walking distance of Ville Delle Stelle. Hollywood was central to the all of the activities we had planned during our short stay, including a visit to the original Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles which is less than half a block away! (As a side note ... go to the Roscoe's on Pico ... better for people/celebrity watching!) I lived in Los Angeles for 10 years so I am comfortable navigating around this city, and I feel very safe on the streets surrounding VDS, but I can see how some may not. We had no problem walking to and from the Arclight theater 3 blocks away. (Another side note ... the Arclight was awesome! We bought our tix in the morning for the evening show. They offer reserved seating so you can stroll in 5 minutes before the start! Just don't be late) The room features a very informative binder with information about local attractions as well as maps and taxi info. The only reason we wouldn't stay here again is if our itinerary includes activities closer to the beach. But as far as service, location, and amenities offered, this place has it all! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Really amazing”
Reviews.Author: TGS67
Reviews.Content: Privacity, good location, spacious, clean and comfortable. It has everyting. WeÂ´d stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Hollywood Gem”
Reviews.Author: jlberger
Reviews.Content: We loved our visit at Villa Delle Stelle. We chose the hotel to be close to the Palladium where we were attending a concert, but the location is near many other attractions as well. The super-star at Villa Delle Stelle was our suite. We stayed in the Art Deco suite that had a full-sized kitchen, dining room, two bathrooms and a guest room/den in addition to a beautiful master bedroom. The attention to detail in everything from the furniture and art work to the luxurious bedding is something not found in any corporate hotel - regardless of the number of stars. We especially loved the privacy afforded to guests that gives the feeling of a well-appointed home away from home. In the spirit of honest critique, I should mention that the wireless internet connection was frustratingly minimal during our stay and the stairs up to the suite might be a challenge for some guests, so best to check this out first if this is an issue for you. However, overall it would be difficult to find a lovelier place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring LA”
Reviews.Author: Max_and_Sandy
Reviews.Content: A beautiful, immaculate place to stay. We were in the Bungalow, and enjoyed being in a lovely old cottage right in the heart of Tinseltown. From here, it's easy to walk to Hollywood, or drive anywhere in LA, and it's great to have the option of self-catering and a laundry when staying for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Oasis of tranquility in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: Mazza82
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay here based purely on Trip Advisor reccomendations and the various good reviews it has are well deserved. We stayed in the Bungalow for 2 nights and it was our first stop after landing at LA from Heathrow before heading off on a drive across California. What we were expecting was good, and it truely lived up to it. There was no protracted check in - we had been advised in advance where the key was and where to park. The main room was spacious with an enormous bed (I felt like I was Dennis Waterman in Little Britain). The kitchen was fully equipped (although we couldn't make the gas oven work) and had a bottle of cider (fizzy apple jiuce) and a freshly baked cake awaiting us. The room had free WiFi and a massive TV with a full digital service. It is a real little oasis just off Sunset Boulevard in Hollywood, the walk of fame is less than 5 minutes walk away and there is a Denny's serving breakfast at the end of the road. We could not have hoped for a better place to stay in LA. Thank you to Brogan and everyone else for making it such a nice place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing change to a hotel, fantasic place...”
Reviews.Author: watsax
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the start of April, we stayed in the Neo Classic room. It was a very refreshing change to a hotel, we found the place (with help from out sat nav) on a quiet street which seemed miles away from the other tourists. We park up down the drive and walked into our room with the key under the mat. The room was beautiful, very very clean, huge, lovely kitchen and a very comfortable bed. Throughout the 3 days we never saw anybody else and left the keys under the mat where we found the in the first place, it was so nice not to have deal with any reception staff (of course i'm sure the staff here are very nice, they certainly was when i spoke to them on the phone!) but was nice not to have to worry. Regarding the location, its a great location for the tourist Hollywood, walk of fame only min away etc, personnally i would prefer and knowing LA now to stay around West Holiday or Santa Monica but that is not to distract from this place. Centrally speaking its ideal to get around, its between Santa Monica Blvd and Hollywood Blvd, only a few blocks east of Vine. All in all we were very happy with this choice and i would recommed it to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful apartment, shame about the bed!!”
Reviews.Author: Ann221
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the English Suite for three nights with our two children aged 14 and 11. The apartment is gorgeous, with every amenity you could need. I was told, however, that the bed in the bedroom was king-size. It was a queen size bed and my kids were rather uncomfortable. My husband and I slept on the sofa bed in the living room. It was TERRIBLY uncomfortable. There was an air mattress that was not sufficiently inflated on top of the very thin sofa bed mattress. Everything else about the apartment was lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden jewel in the big city!”
Reviews.Author: juliatheena
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night in Oct 2007 in the Neo-classic suite. The room was charming, the decor perfect. The bed was very comfortable and everything was within walking distance. Parking was a bit tight, but managed fine. We arrived to a setting of Brie cheese, some crusty baguette and a nice bottle of red wine. It would have been nice if there had been somewhere else to sit besides the bed, but we didn't mind. The room was very quiet, unique, comfy, and worth the price. I would stay here again, though in a bigger suite.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TinkerbellGermany
Reviews.Content: We (young couple from Germany) stayed here for about a week at the end of our honeymoon. We had booked the Bungalow and really liked it! Everything was clean and the size of the Bungalow was perfect for the 2 of us. The kitchen is well equipped, which gave us the chance to safe some money and prepare dinner ourselves. A great place to eat is Fabioulus Cafe, just around the corner! We had some "loud-neighbour-experiences" as well, but- it's in the middle of Hollywood, so what do you expect :-)!? We also liked the folder with the information about the area and the owners were very helpful (you need to be prepared that this is not a typical hotel and the owners are not available all the time). We were not overly impressed with Hollywood, but if we decided to come back, we would definately choose Villa delle stelle again!!

Reviews.Title: “A not-so-hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: Broadron
Reviews.Content: Had a superb three-night stay in the Bungalow, which is a charmingly different place to stay instead of an hotel. Well located in a residential street between Sunset and Hollywood Boulevards, it is within walking distance of Grauman's and the Kodak Theatre on Hollywood. Five minute drive to an entrance to Griffith Park and plenty of eating and drinking places within walking distance or a short drive away. The Bungalow has an allocated parking space at the front and a great private patio area at the back. Inside there are two sleeping areas but no separate living area. There is one large double bed in one tastefully decorated room with two singles in a room leading off, so for that reason it is best suited to a couple or a couple with younger children. Would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loepie
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. We stayed in the Bungalow suite, which has a master bedroom and an extra room with two single beds. There is also a well equipped kitchen and a washing machine, very convenient if you are staying for a longer period of time. There is a great little private patio next to the suite. The neighbourhood is nice with some decent restaurants within walking distance. The wine and cheese waiting for us upon arrival was a pleasant surprise. You never actually see any staff, which is a little strange, but did not bother us.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: mjtreks
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the bungalow, and thought it was truly a home away from home.My wife and I were greeted like we were old friends who dropped by . The accommodations were spacious and comfortable, the kitchen and bathroom a delightful step back in time and fully functional down to the last detail. The courtyard was a perfect place to relax and unwind after a hustle bustle day of sight seeing. Parking was tight but adequate for a small car. The dryer did not work, which was disappointing, but an adequate on- the- premises alternate was made available. This wasn't quite as convenient but considering the perfection of the rest of the experience, we were more than satisfied. The location is on the edge of the main attractions in West Hollywood - I think just close enough via the DASH to make it easily accessible, and far enough away to escape and wind down. LA is such a huge city that I think a car is absolutely necessary but the DASH loops conveniently through all of Hollywood and stops just around the corner from the villa. Brogan and Michael were so welcoming and accommodating, and the bungalow so comfortable and relaxing that I can not imagine a better "hotel" experience. This truly was a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: paultra
Reviews.Content: BEAUTIFUL....Were from the UK and stayed at the bungalow suite for 6 nights in August...We arrived in LA after a wonderful 10 hour drive from San Francisco along the coast road. Villa de Stelle is a real home from home in a perfect location for exploring the whole of LA. The bungalow has everything you will need including BBQ, every utensil you need for cooking etc. The huge bed was amazing and the decor was also very tasteful. The courtyard was also great for those lovely hot LA evenings, humming birds made a regular appearance and i was also lucky enough to come face to face with a racoon one evening. I was surprised to read another review which said that the tumble dryer didnt work which affected their stay?? LA tempreatures this time of year are in their 90s dry your clothes outside, we did. We had a problem with the alarm one evening and we left a message on the office phone outside of hours, less than an hour later Brogan herself popped in and helped sort the problem out (thanks Brogan). Despite what we heard about Hollywood as an area we found it fine. Common sense is needed when out at night but this goes for any major city. We didnt experience any problems when out at night. Everything you need is nearby including restaurants, supermarkets and all tourist attractions. The onsite parking is also very handy we had a 7 seater people carrier and had no problems parking this in the allocated space. Staying at Villa de Stelle made our stay in LA and we cant wait to go back. We will be staying here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Villa Delle Stelle!”
Reviews.Author: Lymond
Reviews.Content: After our battle with the LA traffic it was a lovely place to find waiting for us. A real touch of Hollywood glamour! Not only wine and cheese, but fresh coffee, herbal teas, the basic condiments, washing up liquid and dishwasher detergent all available to use. All the equipment of a great standard â€“ even a kettle and teapot. Very quiet while we were there. Our only quibble in the main bedroom was that we had to get out of bed to put out the bedside lights â€“ or did we miss something? Other than that, we canâ€™t fault the Parisienne Suite. Many thanks to Samantha and Brogan.

Reviews.Title: “A place to come home to in busy Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: ytnchica
Reviews.Content: This is my family's second year coming to Villa Delle Stelle. We stayed 15 nights last year and liked the acommodations so much that we made sure to stay here again for another 15 nights this year. The decor is beautiful and every corner has been paid attention to. The kitchen is perfect for extended vacations with my family. There's a cuisinart/blender, microwave, toaster, full updated gas stove/oven with all the utensils for cooking that you would need. There is wireless high speed internet in each room and a multi purpose fax/copier/printer which has come in handy. We've been able to print out movie and show tickets that we've ordered online while here. The bathroom is stocked with a nice blow dryer, curling iron and full size shampoo, conditioner and shower gel. The towels are much more plush than any hotel I've stayed in before. They definitely beat the Hyatt. Two soft bathrobes are in the closets stocked with nice wooden hangers. I could easily 'move in'. There is a parking space for everyone and it is a bit tight for several of the suites, but a relief since there really isn't any 'free' parking in Hollywood. The streets in Hollywood are typically 1 hour metered or no parking at most times of the day. The area is in the middle of Sunset Blvd and Hollywood Blvd and yes it is a a busy area but we expected lots of city noises. If you want to stay in Hollywood, or any other big city there is a lot of hustle and bustle. My son, daughter and I took a walk down our street one night to watch a film being shot nearby and felt relatively safe. The houses on our street are all very cute and well kept. Brogan and Samantha with Villa Delle Stelle are a pleasure to work with! My son attends a film school in the summers and this is the perfect place for us to be staying. We appreciate all the attention to detail and the comfortable stay. We'll be back. I have actually stayed in 3 of the suites (The English Suite, Parisian and Art Deco). All are nice and styled differently. I have over 40 photos posted of the Parisian and The English suites on www.flickr.com/photos/yarachica .

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SDRivergirl
Reviews.Content: Let's start off with one word - WOW!! This was the best experience we have ever had when staying out of town. We arrived a bit early and the staff was very accomodating and allowed us to go to the suite early. We stayed in the Parisian Suite and when we walked in, we were in awe. It is absoultely beautiful and very spacious. It is basically an apartment with all of the amenities. The kitchen had all appliances and utensils and the bathroom had shampoo, etc. We had my 15 year old nephew and his friend with us and they both said it was the best "hotel" that they have ever stayed at. The beds were extremely compfortable and we have even asked where to get the sheets because we loved them so much. The weekend we were there was very hot - averaging 100 degrees! The AC was not very strong, but with all of the windows open, it was perfect. Do not be alarmed by the neighborhood - it is not as nice as the Villa Delle Stelle, but we felt very safe in our Suite. We recommend this place 100% and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the English Suite”
Reviews.Author: Tixilix
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the English Suite last year after I came across the Villa Delle Stella website whilst looking for accommodation in Los Angeles. The suite has a piano that belonged to Dudley Moore (the owner of Villa Delle Stella was married to Dudley). There are photographs of Dudley, DVDs of his films and books about him which I enjoyed reading. You can tell that the owner of the accommodation is an interior designer as it is very tastefully presented. There is a lounge area with flat screen television, full kitchen facilities, dining area, bedroom and bathroom. We used a washing machine and tumble drier outside the suite. The parking space is small if you have a large vehicle as we did but it is not impossible to park. There is useful information on Los Angeles and tourist attractions in the suite. When we arrived we were met with a bottle of wine and cheese on the dining table which was a nice touch. The only downside of the accommodation is its location in what could be described as a deprived area. I was surprised and saddened at how run down Hollywood is, it is such a shame to see beautiful buildings becoming derelict particularly those in an art deco style. My favourite attraction was the Hollywood Museum in the Max Factor building which was fascinating and not too far from the Villa. It would be great to see more investment and regeneration in the Hollywood area in recognition of unique history.

Reviews.Title: “Like Home!”
Reviews.Author: marians_moreau
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for 5 days at Art Deco Suite. We felt like home. Everything was 5 stars. The location is great, just 8 blocks from Chinese Teathre. Each suite has its own private parking, so you don't have to worry for that. If I would definitely choose it again!

Reviews.Title: “Villa Delle Stelle - Cosy home in LA”
Reviews.Author: Geoff_1979
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Villa Delle Stelle in September 2007 for 5 days during our 2 week holiday touring California. We had a splendid 5 days in LA especially thanks to Villa Delle Stelle. First off it is in an excellent location to easily find your way to all the central attractions in LA as well as bars and restaurants on Sunset Strip. Villa Delle Stelle itself is LA's best kept secret. It is a cosy home in the big city. We stayed in the ground floor apartment, and came away with no complaints. Loads of space, good size living room with plasma tv, dining room, kitchen, bath room and bedroom. Everything is spotless and in good working order. You really do feel like at home in Villa Delle Stelle. Just down the road from Villa Delle Stelle are some local shops for you to stock up on groceries. If your not familiar with the area and you are driving there from the airport, you might want to get Sat Nav with your car, but its not too hard to find. After our long flight, we were so happy to get to Villa Delle Stelle and put our feet up. As I said before the location is perfect, all of LA's main attractions are close by and it is also within easy reach of the freeway if you want to explore further out of the city. We visisted Venice beach and Santa Monica a couple of times during our stay and would recommend you do too. Santa Monica is beautiful and you cant beat an afternoon on the beach (don't forget plenty of sun cream) their after visiting the shops inland. I don't have a single bad word to say about Villa Delle Stelle, but a couple of things you might want to consider before visiting LA. If your from England don't be expecting a City Center full of bars. If you want a lot of night life do a little planning to as where the bars you want to go to are. Although you will find quite a few on Sunset strip, as well as fine places to eat. Second thing, just chill out and enjoy LA.

HotelInfo.Name: Villa Delle Stelle
HotelInfo.Address: 6087 Harold Way, Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90028
